title.narrative: OPT 3.7.2: EVIDENCE BASED POLICY

description.narrative: 3.7.2 Institutional capacity at the national and subnational levels are strengthened to develop inclusive systems that protect the most vulnerable based on evidence-based knowledge., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.7 By 2017, public policies, social protection systems, legal framework, and budget allocations in favour of children, adolescents and vulnerable women are strengthened at national and subnational levels, and are based on evidence and backed by disaggregated data.

participating-org.narrative: UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.7.2 Institutional capacity at the national and subnational levels are strengthened to develop inclusive systems that protect themost vulnerable based on evidence-based knowledge.

description.narrative: Despite reluctance from the Government to publish official data, UNICEF has made progress on generating evidence-based knowledge through working with the National Institute for Statistics (INE). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2017

title.narrative: Women, children and adolescents of indigenous families from Northern Potosi, improved the fulfilment of their rights through the strengthening of human rights capacity and income generation (overcoming poverty) through the Communal Banks initiative

baseline.value: Assessment and reporting of results on women's empowerment and child and adolescent rights of the Communal Banks initiative

target.value: 2017:The Communal Banks initiative functions autonomously and sustainably through the strengthening of the Association of Banks

actual.value: 2015:15 new communal banks were opened including the new regulation based on the recommendations of the consultation on the sustainability of the initiative.

title.narrative: The BolInfo platform has updated information

baseline.value: BolInfo has information based on ENDSA 2008, DHS 2008, Administrative Registries (or Civil Registries) 2008, and Census 2001

target.value: 2017:By 2015, a national information system on children and adolescents is functioning at the MPD/INE.2016-2017: Maintenance and updating of BolInfo

actual.value: 2015:Data warehouse on child indicators finalized and BolInfo updated

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Proportion of children covered by government cash transfer programmes (number of children and % of total)

baseline.value: Bono Juancito Pinto reaches 2.2 M children

target.value: 2017:Integrated SP system reaches 2.5 M children

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2017:CT JCP, Cash Transfers Juana Azurduy, Renta Dignidad

title.narrative: Information systems on children and adolescents exist at the Departmental level to develop policies in favour of children and adolescents, as well as monitor their situation

baseline.value: Cochabamba: Does not have an information system on children and adolescents in place

target.value: 2017:The Departmental government of Cochabamba have child and adolescent information systems in place. Cochabamba Q4 2017

actual.value: 2015:Departmental technical staff trained and developing departmental planning including plan for children

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years

target.value: 2017:At least two reports related to child-focused targets of SDGs

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning/institutionalized mechanisms for child and/or adolescent participation in local planning, budgeting and monitoring processes

target.value: 2017:Third Biennal Congress for children and adolescents in Chuquisaca achieved

actual.value: 2017:Operational Children's Committees at the departmental level

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Partnership/collaboration for policy advocacy for children is established with civic society, NGOs/CSOs, private sector or Parliament Committees

target.value: 2017:At least one specialized course on strategic planning, analysis of data and legislation for Government

title.narrative: Evidence for decision-making is generated based on budgeting and costing models with an equity-based approached in health (MBB), WASH (WASH-BAT) and education (SEE)

target.value: 2017:Plans of action in place that take into account removal of bottlenecks in the Health, WASH and Education sectors of two Departments.

actual.value: 2015:SEE implementation finalized in Chaco region and AWP included findings from simulations

title.narrative: Information systems on children and adolescents exist at the Departmental level to develop policies in favour of children and adolescents, as well as monitor their situation

baseline.value: Oruro: Does not have an integral information system to monitor children

target.value: 2016:Oruro: The Departmental government of Oruro implemented a child and adolescent information system to plan and monitor policies in favour of children and adolescents Q2 2016

title.narrative: Information systems on children and adolescents exist at the Departmental level to develop policies in favour of children and adolescents, as well as monitor their situation

baseline.value: Pando: Does not have an information system on children and adolescents in place.

target.value: 2016:The Departmental government of Pando have child and adolescent information systems in place. Pando Q4 2016.

title.narrative: Information systems on children and adolescents exist at the Departmental level to develop policies in favour of children and adolescents, as well as monitor their situation

baseline.value: Potosi: Integrated System on Infants, Children and Adolescents (Sistema Integrado de la Infancia, Ni?ez y Adolescencia)

target.value: 2017:Information Child Protection System (SID) improved and generating reports

actual.value: 2015:SID currently working online. Primary Source: Sector Management Information System.

title.narrative: The situation analysis (including regional SITANs) are prepared and updated, including a focus on equity and interculturality, as well as a multidimensional poverty study on children and adolescents

target.value: 2015:National SITAN updated to 2015

actual.value: 2016:Conducted technical training will be executed next period

title.narrative: The Social Prevention and Protection Program for working children and adolescents under 14 years of age was implemented

baseline.value: The July 2014 Law 548 is formulated within 2 years and is implemented within the following 3 years

target.value: 2017:A pilot program is implemented

actual.value: 2015:Ongoing discussion with the Ministry of Planning

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Child poverty is explicitly included as part of a national developmen plan or similar, such as a standalone child poverty action plan

target.value: 2017:Updated multidimensional poverty analsis

actual.value: 2017:The analysis is done but not published
